description: Top-down shooter game patterns and best practices for Phaser.js
author: GameForge Team

aiSuggestions.context: You are helping create a top-down shooter game in Phaser.js. Common patterns include: 8-directional player movement, shooting mechanics with bullets/projectiles, enemy spawning in waves, health system, power-ups, score system, weapon upgrades. Use object pooling for bullets and enemies. Implement auto-fire with time events. Use overlap detection for collisions.

commonBugs: Bullets not destroying - Set active/visible false and reuse
Enemies spawning off-screen - Check spawn boundaries
Player moving too fast - Reduce maxSpeed or add drag
Collision not detecting - Use overlap instead of collide for projectiles
Memory leaks - Use object pooling for bullets and enemies
performanceTips: Use object pooling for bullets and enemies
Limit number of active enemies on screen
Use groups for efficient collision detection

physicsSettings.collision: Use overlap for bullets, collide for player
